I have an almost new High Standard full sized 1911 that I would possibly be interested in trading.

These are made by Armscor and are exceptionally tight with no looseness or frame rattle.   Is a mil spec GI model with a flat mainspring housing and spur hammer, but the beavertail is just long enough that I haven't had any problems with hammer bite.  I've run it with cheap mags and cheap ammo and have yet to have a malfunction of any kind.

I'm interested in trading for something full or mid sized in 9mm or .40.  Since its a 1911 it carries IWB very well, but I'd like to have something with a higher capacity if I'm going to have something full sized.

title: For Sale:  Knights Armament SR 15 E3 IWS CARBINE SBR 14.5"         AR15 5.56 Thunderbeast Suppressor Zeiss Red Dot
postcontent:
For sale is  a brand new Knights SR-15E3 IWS CARBINE SBR with a Thunderbeast suppressor and Zeiss Z point Victory Red Dot sight. This rifle not only looks awesome but is compact and lightweight. The dimpled barrel is a unique feature that Knights produces in very limited quantities. It has all of the great features such as the hammer forged barrel, the ambidextrous safety, E3 bolt and more. The Thunderbeast suppressor will be a great addition to your rifle. It is very durable and lightweight. The Zeiss Z point Victory is a unique, red dot sight that not only is battery powered but also solar powered. This sight is small but is very efficient.  This item is new and it has never been fired.From Knights:
This system is the newest line of Short Barrel Rifles (SBR) offered by Knight’s Armament Co. to the commercial market. The SR15 SBR Carbine features some of the latest technology to come out of our facility, including the light weight URX 3.1 13.5” rail system, which extends the full length of the 14.5” dimpled chrome lined Medium profile barrel. This new system continues to utilize the KAC SBR marked IWS lower assembly with its Ambidextrous Features, Match Trigger, and integrated Push Button swivel attachments.

Specs:
Barrel- 14.5" 1:7 Twist, Hammer Forged, Chrome Lined
Caliber-5.56mm
Weight- 6.89lbs
Length-31.5" (stock retracted)

From Thunderbeast:
The model 223A is our full-auto suppressor for 5.56 mm NATO assault rifles. It is designed for extreme durability and high heat loads from full-auto and burst firing schedules. The 223A is ideal for short-barrelled rifle ("SBR") format fighting carbines and M4/M16 pattern rifles, as well as AR-15's that will be used with a high rate of fire.

The 223A was developed specifically for the 7.5-inch Sabre Defence Industries Stealth SBR.

The 223A is made of 316 stainless steel and inconel and features a full-welded baffle core for durability. It has a length of 6.8 inches, 0.4 less than the 223P, to keep over-all length of the carbine relatively short. Muzzle blast concussion is eliminated and the recoil impulse is reduced and smoothed over time. The 223A improves the accuracy of most rifles. It is sealed and requires no maintenance.

The 223A is ideal for fighting carbines including full-auto applications.

Specs:
Caliber: 223 caliber, 5.56 mm NATO
Material: 316 Stainless Steel and Inconel
Length: 6.8 inches.
Diameter: 1.5 inches.
Weight: 22.7 ounces
Threads: 1/2-28 (US standard)
Finish: Black
Use: full-auto rated, 7-inch barrel OK.

From Zeiss:
Quick and resilient:
The sealed housing offers reliable protection to both optical and electronic parts. Discover the benefits of the automatic intensity regulation of the illuminated dot on your next driven hunt and experience for yourself the ultra-rapid target acquisition. The technology that lies within this compact reflex sight offers you significant advantages: the illuminated dot has a manual as well as an automatic digital control system - ensuring maximum security and precision in terms of function. Another smart feature is the combination of batteries and solar cell. This leads to virtually unlimited function and total reliability

Totally secure housing:
When you need something for the most challenging conditions, where you need complete reliability of your equipment, the Victory Z-Point is the right sight for you. The waterproof and dustproof aluminum housing offers reliable protection for the optics and electronics when tracking in dense undergrowth or in thick snow.

Tried and tested LotuTec® coating:
Keep your target clearly in sight whatever the weather. Water simply rolls off the tried and tested LotuTec® coating, ensuring clear visibility even in rain and snow. This innovative protective layer also makes it quick and easy to remove dust and dirt.

Hybrid power supply:
Depending on the light conditions, the power is supplied either by a CR 2032 battery or by the integrated solar cell. This ensures a reliable and long-lasting power supply, meaning that you can always rely on the secure function of your reflex sight.

Versatile mounting options:
Two mounting options are available, allowing you to mount the sight on your rifle directly and quickly. A Weaver version is available to fit on the rails available for most sporting firearms alongside a Picatinny versions for many civilian versions of military arms that are rail equipped.

Operation:
As with the Victory Compact Point, the sight is turned on and off using the large, easy-to-use function button. The brightness regulation of the illuminated dot is controlled automatically by the ambient light. You can use the manual override at any time, depending on the intensity of illumination you prefer in any particular hunting situation.

title: Want To Buy:  Looking to build a steam engine / generator, need help.
postcontent:
I've been looking to build a steam engine for power generation. Nothing huge or industrial, just moderate-sized to power something like a fridge or washing machine. A lot of people who have gas or diesel generators as a safe guard aren't considering the fact that the pumps at gas stations will also be off, rendering their generators useless once they run out of fuel. A steam generator wouldn't, because water and wood is plentiful around here.

I'm learning carpentry, blacksmithing and basic mechanics... but a steam engine is beyond me, so I need some help putting one together and learning how it operates. If anyone has any experience in this and would like to work on this as a fun project, let me know. I live south of East Aurora and have a pretty nice workshop, complete with beer fridge, not to mention I posted this ad on ArmsList...

title: For Sale:  Mossberg MMR 65014 AR-15 ar15 30 round magazines
postcontent: Mossberg MMR Tactical Ar-15 "assault rifle" model #65014 new in box with paperwork, lock, and (1) 30 round aluminum magazines. This rifle features black phosphate/anodized aluminum finishes, a Stark SE-1 pistol grip with battery compartment, a 6 position adjustable stock by UTI, a Picatinny quad-rail forearm and top rail, rail mounted front/rear adjustable sights, and a stock sling mount. The free float rails are designed to fit all the tactical gear that you can carry. Unlike many ARs, this is a standard feature which you won't end up spending more to upgrade the rail set-ups. It has an efficient autoloading direct-impingement gas system for ejection of spent cartridges and auto reloading. No forward assist is necessary for a rifle this smooth. It does have a dust cover, a large trigger hole, and nice charging handle. The blued barrel is 16.25", rifled for 1 in 9" and ends with the muzzle-flash suppressor. The receiver, magazine release, and charging handle are all well designed to make use and maintenance reliable and easy. The upper and lower separate easily with two pins for service and cleaning. The receiver accepts 5.56 Nato ammunition as well as .223 Remington brass or steel casings. It has a 31 round capacity and is a real front-runner in the AR style market. Colt also makes a good quad rail set-up like this, but is generally much more costly. Mossberg redefined affordable with .223s and the .22lr. They have been around over 90 years. They must be doing something right. Mossberg offers their two year manu. warranty on this product. I have additional 30 round factory Mossberg magazines for sale. ************* LEGAL STUFF I HAVE TO TELL YOU: I cannot ship this gun or the magazine to the following places because of round capacity and/or "assault weapon features"--California, Massachusetts, Maryland, Connecticut, New Jersey, New York, Colorado, District of Columbia, Chicago, Aurora, IL, and Cook County. I will not ship to Hawaii or Alaska for shipping reasons. The rest of Illinois, you will have to send a current FOID card and Driver's License. All rifles ship to a current FFL holder so set this up early.A signed copy of your valid FFL should accompany your check or E-mail to my address. Check with your state to make sure you don't need to be 21 to purchase this firearm. If you default on your contract to pay upon auction closing, appropriate measures will be taken. If there is any doubt, don't click on the "submit bid" button, please. Thank you for looking, sorry for the legal garbage, and God bless. Contact me with questions.

title: Want To Buy:  AK 47
postcontent: Was looking to pick one up this weekend in decent shape / wood not folding / without any issues for the price it should be, not the used car salesman pre - post speech. Let's be real, we could go on for hours about why specific things have specific price tags whether arms  related or simply a cup of coffee. Wages are going down yet the prices of everything from gas to groceries are skyrocketing. Honestly when is the last time you bought something without feeling like you've been ripped off? These tough times reveal true colors and it's pretty darn disappointing to see such price gauging even amongst us and our sport. If you're the handshake type and would like to make an honest deal with an honest price without capitalizing on a hard working blue collar let's make it happen.

title: For Sale:  Springfield Micro-Compact Operator
postcontent:
It pains me greatly to do this, but I've found it necessary to part with my Springfield Lightweight Micro-Compact Bi-Tone Operator. Quite the mouthful, I know. This honey is an Officers-size 1911, with a 3" cone-type bushingless barrel. The pistol comes with the following custom touches from the factory:
 Beavertail grip safety
 Skeletonized hammer
 Three-hole skeletonized trigger with overtravel stop
 Extended, ambidextrous thumb safety
 Novak-style Trijicon night sights
 Flat, checkered mainspring housing with Springfield Integrated Locking System (ILS).

The pistol still wears the factory cocobolo wood grips, and also has a polished feed ramp. It was bought new in October 2012, total round count is somewhere in the neighborhood of 200. It was my EDC for most of the summer, and shows some light, cosmetic only wear on the frame due to that. Most wear is on or near the trigger guard. It has been carried a lot, but shot very little. Comes with everything you get from the factory, which is:

Plastic case
 2 6-round mags
 Polymer holster (Right hand), and double mag pouch
 Disassembly tools and 2 ILS keys
 Streamlight X2/XML rail-mounted weapon light (the pistol does have a rail)
 Owner's manual and all paperwork.

I'll also include a 7-round Chip McCormick magazine with removable extended base pad, and a Cobra Gunskin IWB holster, right hand. The holster is well-used, but still has tons of life left in it.

Asking $950 for all of it. Not interested in any firearm trades this time, the only trade I will consider is an 80s Honda Shadow or similar cruiser-type motorcycle, valued similarly to the pistol.

Pursuant to current Colorado law, this will have to be an FFL transaction, and the buyer will have to complete a CBI check. It sucks, I know, but we've gotta stay on the up and up, especially in the current political climate.  I will pay transfer fees up to $35 at any FFL we can mutually agree on. My apologies for the lousy quality pics, I can email or text more/better ones on request. I'm in Lakewood, but am willing/able to deal pretty much anywhere in the metro area, and possibly beyond. Email me with questions or offers, and as always, thanks for viewing.

title: For Sale/Trade:  S&W M&P .45 and Marlin 336, 30-30.
postcontent:
Both are great guns, and come with a few extras.
The M&P is in .45, and I have 2x10 round mags, and 2x14 round mags.
I have a Blackhawk CQC holster, and a kydex adjustable tension mag pouch. 
A TLR-1 tactical light, a standard barrel, and a threaded barrel.
I can also throw in 50 rounds.

The Marlin 336 is a 30-30 lever action rifle. Holds 6+1, and functions, as well as looks, good. I have a rail mounted on it, but have since used the rings and scope for other rifles. Also have a sling which holds 4 rounds, and a buttstock sleeve which holds 9, though I can find other uses for those if you can't.
Also have around 60 assorted rounds.


Reasons why I'm looking to trade:
I have a Yugo SKS which I love, and seeing as how 30-30 and 7.62x39 are incredibly similar, I can't really justify having both.

With the M&P, I'm slowly trying out every type of handgun I can. This gun is the most recent, and while it's accurate, and hasn't had any problems with the 100-150 rounds I've fired from it, it just isn't "right" for me.

 Product Description:

 Spot and strike in an instant with the unlimited eye relief of the Bushnell HOLOsight Riflescope. Bead up on a bird as soon as you raise your gun! The Bushnell HOLOsight series features advanced holographic technology that projects the appearance of an illuminated crosshair 50 yards in front of your gun, without projecting any light. You can sight from any distance behind the gun with unlimited eye relief and field-of-view. title: For Trade:  NICE REM700 W/ BULL BARREL
postcontent: I am considering trading my Remington 700 chambered in 30-06 Springfield. It has a couple of after market modifications done to it. It has a brand new free floating E.R. Shaw Bull Barrel with a 1/10 Right Hand twist. When ER Shaw installed the barrel they also Trued it to the receiver meaning that the barrel/chamber now sits perfectly in the receiver and lines up perfectly with the bolt face. I have put the barrel through the initial break in of firing one round then cleaning the barrel with Hoppes solvent repeating the process for 10 rounds. Also the rifle comes with a H-S Precision kevlar composite M24A1 stock that is equipped with an aluminum bedding block. The scope is nothing special. It is simply a cheap no name scope that I picked up from Gander Mountain. It also comes with the Bipod. This rifle will stack rounds through one ragged hole at 100 meters. However, I have not had an opportunity to push it out there on the range. That being said I would not be surprised if this rifle is capable of hitting a 1 minute target at 600-800 meters, and I am pretty confident that it can be done with this weapon in the hands of a capable shooter. Slap some good glass on this bad boy and maybe an aftermarket trigger and you have a true sniper rifle chambered in 30-06. With all of that being said, I by no means have to get rid of this rifle; I just really want to see if theres something out their that catches my eye. I estimate the value of this rifle to be worth somewhere between $1,000 and $1,200 after the mods I've done to it. If you'd like to make an offer, I'd be interested in pretty much all firearms, especially pistols, AR's, and other long guns. I can be reached by phone call or text at REDACTED ask for Jake. Worst I can say is no thank you.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Antique Spur Trigger Revolver
postcontent:
I have what I believe is a Iver Johnson spur trigger revolver made in the early to mid 1870s it fires 22 cal. short black powder cartridges only with a 4 digit serial number 14xx. The cylinder locks while at rest spins at the 1st notch of pulling it back for loading and lock again at full cock it indexes as it should.  The revolver retains almost none of the original nickel plating and someone blued the bare metal at least that is the way it looks. The bore is good with minor pitting and some lands and groves still showing; the cylinder is in good condition the grips are in good condition for there age with only 1 minor crack in the right hand grip. I have fired this revolver quite a bit with 22 short cowboy loads it is a very nice antique. 

If you have any questions please e-mail me I will answer ASAP. I will not trade or sell this revolver to anyone that is not 21 years old or older so do not ask me to.
